name: La Quinta Inn & Suites Houston Hobby Airport

reviews.text: Good location, close to airport. Clean well equiped rooms and facilities. Espescially welcome is the business facility. Difficult to use food/drink dispensing machines and laundry because there is no way to make change!! Internet can be slow in rooms. Otherwise a comfortable, convenient stay.
reviews.title: Good - will stay again.

reviews.text: I stayed here back in May of 2012 for one night as we got into town late and I was picking someone up at the airport next door. I had just stayed at a La Quinta Inn in AUSTIN, TEXAS (See a previous review) the night before and I was a bit skeptical as my previous night stay was not a good one. However, the photo's looked safe and the building looked new so I figured why not try it. I was blown away at how much of a better hotel this was then the one in Austin.
reviews.title: Very Nice for the Price
Thanksgiving week stay
reviews.text: The lobby was bright and clean with no smells. I got their early and though my room wasn't ready yet, they made it a priority to have it ready as soon as possible. The staff was very friendly, helped me out with directions.

reviews.title: Layover
reviews.text: The location is perfect, only a mile away from the Airport and literally right next door to an Enterprise Rent A Car, the airport location which was perfect for me to get my car.

I fly into Houston Hobby a couple of times a month and tend to stay that the La Quinta Hobby Airport the night before an early departure. The hotel is very convenient to the airport with a shuttle service and also easy access to all major rental car companies. The staff is friendly and the hotel is clean. The rooms are large and comfortable and I especially like the large desk and work area. The breakfast is ok but not great. They also tend to be a little slow on getting it going in time; however, I usually am rushing to the airport so I don't have time for breakfast anyway. Others have noted how quiet this hotel is and I agree. It is a very comfortable hotel and I would highly recommend it for anyone going in or out of Houston Hobby.
reviews.title: Always a good stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here two nights at the end of a Texas trip. As most La Quintas are, the price was right, the room was clean and comfortable - but breakfast left a little to be desired. We opted to go to a neighborhood diner-type place for breakfast.
reviews.title: A Good Deal Convenient to the Airport

reviews.text: Staff here were very friendly and helpful. One BIG plus for this place is its location. It is on the road to the airport and maybe 2 miles from the terminal.
reviews.title: Well what can i say?! one of the best hotel stays ever!

reviews.text: . Everything was perfect. I arrived a few hours early but my room was ready ! very nice and helpful reception staff ( i arrived around 1:00pm on 5/1/13). I stayed on second floor ( i asked for quietest area and the lady at desk made sure i had the quietest area although the hotel generally seemed quiet). I had the perfect corner room. I had the best sleep all 4 days. very comfortable bed.. nice super clean bathroom, big room. Because there was a refrigerator and microwave, i was able to go to the foodtown store about 2 miles away for some groceries to save on going out to dinner.
reviews.title: No housekeeping staff at night

reviews.text: The only thing i can say,and its not a criticism, its more of a suggestion: i suggest getting warmer fluorescent lighting. The lighting was a little too cool/harsh. As far as the area, there is not much directly there, but normally at airports there isnt, so you will need a car if you plan on going anywhere. But things are close by. Foodstores, restaurants all a few miles away. Convention center about 10 miles away right off 45 North.
reviews.title: Perfect for a quick stop over!!!
Conveniently located for Hobby
reviews.text: We chose this hotel for convenience and had no problems. It is close to a parking spot which made for an easy transfer. We liked the water pressure of the shower. Front desk attendant was friendly. Would stay here again for proximity to Hobby.

Mom and I checked in on sunday evening, I prepaid for my room for 4 nights. My mom is a social person and chooses to read and spend time in the lobby while I am attending to matters around town. I get back to the hotel this is Tuesday evening...I asked the front desk lady for a key ..after waiting for her to get off a personal phone call....she rudely turns to me and says what room are you in...even after I put my drivers license on the counter for her to pull up on the computer....I do not want to give my room number due to security issues but then just whisper it to her she was in an unpleasant mood. be
reviews.title: Horrible experience Front desk, van driver and management

reviews.text: I stay in hotel rooms 300 days a year and have never been treated this way by a front desk person....so I get up to the room and My mother tells me she had been verbally mistreated by the staff...so I ask her what happened...she said the van driver told her to "[--] off" and told her to go to her room ...she was not supposed to be in the lobby area.....
reviews.title: I was fooled!

reviews.text: as soon as I heard this I called corporate and complained. the customer service representative that evening couldn't do anything and took the front desk clerks word over my mothers...I was steaming...I couldn't leave the hotel that second....because it was after 10pm and had a work deadline to complete....
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.text: Nice hotel, but in need of an upgrade. When we stayed there was no flat screen tv’s. The breakfast area was using the cleaning spray on the waffle maker instead of pam or some other spray release. My wife and grand daughter both became ill after using the hot tub. Avoid it at all costs.
reviews.title: In need of an upgrade

reviews.text: We stayed here after a cruise out of Galveston, TX on March 10, 2013. The hotel is older and shows some wear. However, even though an older hotel is kept very clean. It looks like there has been some attempts at upgrading re: granite in the bath and table top for the TV. Our room still had the older style tv's instead of flat screens.
reviews.title: Older Hotel, Needs updating, but very clean.
Disappointed night of march 13th at laquinta hobby airport blvd.
reviews.text: The staff was very considerate and was able to check us in early. She also directed us and provided a map to some nearby restaurants in the area until our room was ready. The checkout staff also was very courteous and called the shuttle for us at 5am for our departing flight out of Houston Hobby Airport.

The location is very close to the airport, less than 5 minutes. It is also very close to the Enterprise Rental Car return/pickup. That made it very convenient to rent a vehicle for the time we were in Houston. The rental price was a very affordable $29.00 for the day.
reviews.title: Good for business travel

reviews.text: The only disapointment we experienced in this hotel is that the jacuzzi was not working. It was a cool/windy day and we were really looking forward to relaxing in the whirlpool.
reviews.title: mother and daughter Houston,TX.

aka: La Quinta Inn Houston Hobby Airport Hotel
